oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Harper's Weekly, April 19, 1862. Parson Brownlow.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Parson Brownlow, The Exile from Tennessee. (Etching and article). Harper's Weekly, April 19, 1862. (page 253). Article includes biographical sketch of William Gannaway Brownlow, his career, his writings,jail, and his pro-Union activities during the Civil War. Also,'No Name' by Wilkie Collins.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Etchings; Portraits; Civil wars; Newspapers;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: April 19, 1862. HARPER'S WEEKLY. Parson Brownlow, The Exile from Tennessee. PARSON BROWNLOW OF TENNESSEE. Herewith we publish a portrait of the famous Parson Brownlow of Tennessee, whose escape out of the hands of the rebels is the subject of so much comment. The following sketch of the Par son's life has been prepared by one of his friends: (remainder of article not transcribed)
